intro: Psorospermum macrophyllum, commonly known as the large-leaved psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Psorospermum macrophyllum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
